website_summaries.verdict: AT&T customers looking for a durable and high-end smartphone can't go wrong with the Galaxy S7 Active.
pros: The Galaxy S7 Active has extra long battery life and is resistant to dust, water and drops
It has has the same speedy performance, expandable storage and excellent camera quality as the original S7
cons: The bulky, plastic design feels cheap compared with the glass-and-metal S7 and the phone is expensive

customer_reviews.title: Great product just avoid buying it from Mobile Shop USA
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased at least 5 refurbished unlocked phones and all of them have arrived in good contitions except the one I bought from Mobile Shop USA. The phone was faulty and the screen failed the moment I splashed some water on it (the phone is supposed to be water-resistant and be able to withstand a splash or two). My conclusion is that the phones that they provide are not quality products and should not be certified refurbished. I encourage buying unlocked phones just avoid buying from them. I bought another Samsung S7 Active from another provider and it has worked perfectly; I have actually submerged it fully in water and nothing has happened.
customer_reviews.author: Agustin

customer_reviews.title: Being "unlocked"  DOES NOT mean that you can use wifi-calling or several other features on networks other than ATT.
customer_reviews.text: The phone is fine except for one key problem that led me to replace it after only 3-months: Being "unlocked" DOES NOT mean that you can use wifi-calling or several other features on networks other than ATT. I have Tmobile and would need the G891T version of this phone. This is particularly important to me because of a very weak signal inside my apartment, so I miss many calls without the wifi connection.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Regets

customer_reviews.title: Came like new!!
customer_reviews.text: Came in like brand new! No marks at all! Beautiful! One thing I had to figure out myself is that it came with the old 6.0 software where Samsung galaxy phones have 7.0. I spent a long time trying to figure out how to update because it told me software was up to date. To save you time, I finally figured it out. You need to put a micro sd card in your phone in order to upgrade it.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Questionable screen
customer_reviews.text: I had a line of pixels die in the screen two months in. I'm trying to work with both Amazon and my credit card company to get either a refund or it fixed. It's a decent phone but I'm disappointed something that's supposed to be durable had a technical failure so early without any stress.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Good phone when it works. Locked again and cannot be used.
customer_reviews.text: Nice phone. In the beginning everything okay. Used a German SIM card. Left Germany for a couple of month. When I returned the phone did not connect to the Provider anymore. Checked with the provider and with Samsung. No use. Checked in the States with AT+T where the phone is initially from. Phone is locked with AT+T. They cannot unlock because the old user did not pay his/her plan and is still registered to the phone. Without number and password nothing that can be done. Can through it away and buy another one
customer_reviews.author: Christian K.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but is a gamble
customer_reviews.text: Buying refurbished is always a gamble. Not sure if I would go with Wireless2Go. I'm having to send the phone back for the second time (first time there was an issue with the screen, now it has issues charging). They won't send a replacement, so you have to ship the phone and wait for them to process and send back. About to be another 2 weeks without a phone for a month total. It's barely been a month with the phone... if the phone had worked initially or they would send a replacement with a second issue so I wouldn't be without a phone, rating would be higher.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Didnt recognize my sim + huge scratch
customer_reviews.text: Only worked for one day, until i restarted it and it would recognize my sim again no matter what i did and had a huge scratch on the screen. Could not return because i left the country.. my loss... Bummer
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Seow

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I had this phone only 2 months and already as the pink line of death....
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PHONE
customer_reviews.text: I had this phone less than a year. Never dropped the phone, had a protective cae and a glass screen protector and randomly had a dot on the screen with a line running thrpugh it, showing that the lcd had a defect in it. I contacted the seller and do not recommend anyone waste their time on purchasing this device.
customer_reviews.author: william bickel

customer_reviews.title: Awful battery life 👎
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay phone but how TF do you make an "active phone" with such a short battery life? It's 2018; we can't make a phone last more than 2 hours? Huge thumbs down for that.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: "Certified Refurbished"
customer_reviews.text: This phone was terrible quality when I received it. It was dirty, had scuffs and scratches (Big Ones) and had dead pixels in the top corner of the screen. I will never be buying a Certified Refurbished Phone ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great phone.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second S7 Active, so I definitely like this phone. It works very well, has a great camera and is durable. Note that while it is water resistant, moisture in the charging port will make it impossible to charge the phone on a cord until it is completely dry. I suggest that you get a wireless charger for those occasions, and for everyday use, for that matter. It is 2019, after all!
customer_reviews.author: CapnCaveman

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love my phone
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my phone... The phone is steady and it does everything as described... I can personally say that it has been one of the best phone I have own.... However, I have had the phone for close to three months.... and the phone gave me a little problem by stalling on me... I contacted the Company concerning the problem and I got an immediately response... The company honor the warranty on the phone and immediately sent me a replacement... I am a please customer....
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Bell

customer_reviews.title: Like brand new!
customer_reviews.text: It says "refurbished", but the one I got seems brand new to me. Not a single blemish on it. Works like new; and the transfer from my old Samsung was super easy using a transfer cable. I love the 'Active' series and thus far have been impressed with their durability and reliability. I have dropped an S7 active before and the screen did crack, but they are not indestructible. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Burger

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Seller for this product is wonderful
customer_reviews.text: This is more a review for Mobile Supply (the seller) than the phone itself. A few months after purchase my husband had some issues with the phone. The seller responded quickly and instructed us to send the phone back to them over night. My husband was upset that he'd have to go a week or more without his phone. Not the case. Mobile Supply fixed the phone the same day they received it and overnighted it back to us. All for no change. They kept us up to date on the status the entire time. They were awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Joy Fam

customer_reviews.title: pretty good smart phone
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous to buy a refurbished phone but it came with the amazon guarantee so I gave it a try. So far so good. Looks basically like new, maybe one area that looks a little worn. Seems to be working great and charging properly. I will update as it gets older. I have been using it one week.
customer_reviews.author: laurie rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Poor Durability
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the S7 Active refurbished just over a year ago and both the menu button and the back button have fallen off the phone. The buttons starting feeling mushy within a few months of the purchase and eventually the adhesive completely failed. I've never dropped the phone and it's generally had an easy life over the past year so the lack of durability is quite disappointing. I'm not sure if this is a quality issue for all S7 Active's or low quality refurbishment from this supplier.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: decent phone
customer_reviews.text: The only reason we are rating this down, is that although it said unlocked, it was actually still internally connected to AT&T. We learned that this is evident by the model number ending in an "A". If you want a truly 'unlocked' phone, you need to order one that ends with a "U". Otherwise, this phone would have been fine if we were on an AT&T network. It did not work with our carrier.
customer_reviews.author: D Hertz

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It came in right on time and was easy enough to set up. Photos are outstanding and durability is even better. What I like most about this phone is the battery. It lasts me most of the day on constant use and about 2 days on mild use.
customer_reviews.author: Brenton H.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for even better price!
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of these phones and I am so surprised with how great of phones they are. They came brand new, with chargers. My sons have had them for a few months now and still are not experiencing any problems. The charge is still holding great, battery life is so long. I bought cases for both phones to keep them in excellent condition as well. Overall, excellent phones for excellent price! I recommend 100%
customer_reviews.author: Kelsee Culver

customer_reviews.title: Price for the purpose was good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this renewed phone for my spouse who has been using a flip phone. This is the first move into a real smartphone, and I didn't want to spend a lot of $. This is gr8! We love that the "active" is an option from Samsung for better phone protection. I feel good about this purchase and the outreach from the shipper has been fantastic as well.
customer_reviews.author: Patti J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2, for my very active teenage boys. They are not gentle with their phones, they don't just shatter screens, they demolish screens! The S7 active phone is their only hope. These phones are more like new condition. No scratches at all, and work like new phones. We are very satisfied with this purchase. THANK YOU! :)
customer_reviews.author: queenbeedd

customer_reviews.title: pink line across the screen
customer_reviews.text: the phone came defective with a pink line running across the screen.
customer_reviews.author: bc

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, crappy quality!
customer_reviews.text: I had techventure deliver my first galaxy s7 active, scratched, dented and not unlocked. Raised a stink about it and it was replaced no problem. Have had the replacement for almost 3 months and a bright pink line has developed on my screen. When I run my fingers over certain places the pink line will briefly go away just to return when I release pressure. Techventure is not checking their used phones nor do the refurbish them. My guess is that they buy broken screen phones really cheap, swap the broken screen and resell at top dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Justin S

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: Owned just a few days -Phone looks great - glass if perfect - outside covers are perfect - battery came as 86 percent charged.... buttons all work correctly... image, speaker, microphone are good... everything seems to work great... however; only question is that the battery seems to discharge pretty quickly - but, the phone has been upgrading apps and system - maybe that's the reason? I'll update if everything goes to hell in a hand basket.. until then... It's a thumbs up for me...
customer_reviews.author: Bandit

customer_reviews.title: This product is terrible
customer_reviews.text: EVER SINCE I BOUGHT THIS PHONE FOR MY SON IT HAS BEEN HORRIBLE. IT HAS TO BE ON SPEAKER TO HEAR WITHOUT AN ECHO. I A VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH AMAZON AND THIS PRODUCT!!! S...H...A..M....E..F..U..L..L..!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Kliebert

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I love the phone! yet I received my unit with a screen burn in. For 400 dollars I would say that it is not worth it for a refurbished device. You never know what you will get
customer_reviews.author: Christian Eljuri

customer_reviews.title: RIDICULOUSLY FLAWED!!! restarts whenever camera or gallery are opened.
customer_reviews.text: If anything, I was expecting the programs to work but there'd be some cosmetic issues. It has been the complete opposite. Whenever the gallery or camera apps are opened, even for a second, the entire phone freezes and restarts on its own. The company has agreed to take the phone back and supply me a new one, but now I am dealing with the hassle of being without a phone again for whatever amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: Loved the Samsung Galaxy Active line since the S5, and the S7 version is absolutely a fantastic example of the line. Active tools features work great, camera is fantastic, and no more worrying about dropping it in a puddle on a hike. The Renewed phone from Amazon was like new and in perfect condition. Definitely recommend getting a Renewed if at all possible.
customer_reviews.author: humanoid

customer_reviews.title: Not refurbished, more like used.
customer_reviews.text: The phone seems to work perfectly so far, however, the phone seems more like a used phone than refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not what's it cracked up to be
customer_reviews.text: Like the design, case, waterproof and ruggedness. That doesn't matter when in battery savings mode, closing apps when not in use, and trying everything i can think of......its battery life is about 12 hours. Also apps are slow. Battery often gets hot. Charging as I type and battery is going down.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Beat up and dirty ports
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box and it was dirty. Dings and dents all over. The volume buttons were stuck and the phone would crash every 5 minutes. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: If you're hearing impaired or anal rentetive (like me) this isn't your phone.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great phone for the price. My 2 complaints and the reason I returned it was 1) you can't adjust the volume with the side rocker buttons while the screen is off and phone is locked. 2) it comes loaded with a bunch of cool but useless (for me) Samsung apps that you can't uninstall or disable. The sound level was also took quiet for me as a person with hearing loss. Touch screen is very sensitive. But I'm sure for normal users not a nerd like me who hacks his toaster this is a good phone.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Kelly

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: While it's always a hit-and-miss scenario with refurbished handsets, this one was a massive let-down :((( Here's a short list of problems which presented straight out of the box: little or no GPS, unending errors with contacts and messages apps, crashes when messages input/received, apps freezing, etc, etc, ad infinitum.... Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TRUTH BRINGER

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: Terrible purchase. First time I've purchased a renewed product, and now I know that I never will again. A pink line appeared on the screen (I'm assuming this is why the phone was originally returned and renewed) It is supposed to be covered under the Amazon Renewed Product Guarantee, however when I emailed them on the 90th day I received a response that the warranty had expired. This leads me to believe the company repairing these and the Amazon guarantee are both garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Pink line of Death on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Pink line of death that comes and goes on arrival. Accepted a partial refund as I need the device ASAP. Hope I don't regret! Keep posting review and it keeps not going up btw. Lovely. 3 Months later and the back is now bulging indicating a battery issue. Attempting to get a resolution reached. Never mind it is past 90 days. This is a product that never should of been sent. "works and looks like new" is open to translation.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Only complaint about this phone is that the buttons are ...
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint about this phone is that the buttons are not durable at all. Out of 32 phones purchased, 2 of them have had the back button fall off after only 6 months. I suspect that I will see more of this issue over time.
customer_reviews.author: Robs

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, except out of three I've received
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, except out of three I've received, I've had a hardware issue with all of them. Two had screen issues, a pink/red line down the right hand side of the screen which support said is a sign of screen failure. Returned. One had an issue with calls, caller would say that bad echoing was occurring, on my side, the conversation was choppy and distorted. It's on its way back. Maybe I have been unlucky, but 3/3 phones from different sellers each having an issue, I'm done trying with this phone. Which is a shame, because everything else about the phone is great. Maybe you might have better luck....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great used phone!
customer_reviews.text: This phone was exactly as described and works perfectly. I am also pleased with the battery life. Very good for a used phone. My only complaint so far (I've only had it for a month) is that the charger it came with was pretty useless (veeeerrrry slow charging). I have a lot of extra chargers so that wasn't a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Longpre

customer_reviews.title: Should of known better
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as refurbished. Seemed good for the first couple days other than the screen being extra sensitive.. then after the first week the screen got light lines across it like the brightness is messed up but when adjusted it doesn't change anything.. bottom line save the time and hassle.. just by new
customer_reviews.author: Jspataro

customer_reviews.title: S7 Active!
customer_reviews.text: It is a fantastic phone! However, there is one drawback. No one can understand me when I talk on the phone. There is a constant reverb or echo that makes actual phone conversation undoable. After alot of research, I can find no solution to this dilemma. I am returning the phone.
customer_reviews.author: christian mandregan

customer_reviews.title: Review For Frantic Frogs
customer_reviews.text: Frantic Frogs was very quick to get my phone to me the phone was just as described however I could not use it with my carrier-they are being very helpful with the return! Earlier I accidentally left them a bad review-it was meant for someone else not them so please disregard my first review! They are absolutely wonderful and I would be very comfortable buying from them again! Sally Harper
customer_reviews.author: Sally Harper

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: After three months it will not charge, tried resetting it changing cords all to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished=Banged up and Scratched
customer_reviews.text: Phone showed up on time and turned on so I'm giving them 2 stars out of pitty but oh boy was this bad. Phone was covered in numerous scratches and I'm not talking your normal wear and tear, this phone looked like it was used as a tennis ball replacement. Parts of the phone casing were chipped/chunked out as well. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: FightinCowboy

customer_reviews.title: Faulty device
customer_reviews.text: I received my S7 Active which appeared to be in very good condition. I had no issues with the phone until I was told by everyone that I called that they were getting echo/feedback on their end of the call. I made sure my software was up to date and did a reset of the phone and the issue persisted. It appears the phone was not fully tested before being sent out. I also attempted to call the seller, wireless2go, and explained the issue. All they said was "Oh, we don't do that." I will be returning the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Devyn R.

customer_reviews.title: Good Phone
customer_reviews.text: Good phone, works as expected. The only problem was The screen has a pinpoint black dot on it. I’m not sure if it had anything to do with the fact that it was refurbished Or not but it doesn’t affect the way it runs and it’s not big enough to really be visually distracting so we kept the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Crouch

customer_reviews.title: A Great Phone for A Great Price
customer_reviews.text: A very clean and well-kept phone. No scratches, no dents and battery & plug are original Samsung. Came well packaged. Phone in excellent condition and great value for your money!
customer_reviews.author: Chryssy67

customer_reviews.title: Not really an upgrade, but a decent phone nonetheless.
customer_reviews.text: Lumpier than the S6 Active for no reason. I wish I could get one that wasn't an obvious refurb / water rescue.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: After few months pink line showed up on the right side. Software trouble!!
customer_reviews.author: Jaka

customer_reviews.title: Phone reported lost/stolen then sold online
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone for my kid, for Christmas. Ordered in October, doing early christmas shopping because he saw this item and asked for it. Well he tried to use it after setting it up, worked good for 1 hr. Then service got shut off, called my provider. They said that this phone has been reported lost or stolen so it was unable to be used.
customer_reviews.author: latosha

customer_reviews.title: Great provider of reconditioned phones
customer_reviews.text: Great reconditioned phone. Like new, my 2nd Galaxy active phone. Save big over a new one. S8 Active $850+ and this is a better phone, S8 has no physical home key so if you are wearing gloves it's a problem This phone looks fantastic but is super strong waterproof you don't need a case!
customer_reviews.author: Romans828

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: I grabbed another s7 Active since I loved my old one that died on me. It is still a great phone, but for some reason my fingerprint reader stopped working after a few weeks. D tech's ability to please the customer is lacking greatly. They won't exchange the phone without me being without a phone for a week or more. I'll keep it as a spare, I hope they didn't make a profit on my purchase. Who knows how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: OCHS

customer_reviews.title: Came in almost new condition
customer_reviews.text: Had this phone before and destroyed it (I really tried lol). This was a much cheaper alternative to buy this one than use my mobile insurance. Came a like new condition and in the gold color that was stated. So far battery life is good. Does come with a no name charger but I have lots of Samsung chargers so not a big deal; the generic chargers are stated in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Worst experience ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst buying phone experience ever. I bought this phone as “certified” and came with screen with some lines. So it’s clearly a non certified / reviewed device. Save your money and your time
customer_reviews.author: JOSE F. DEL VALLE P.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The screen had been burnt by some kind of text page, the battery was only about 40-50% capacity, and they sent me an S8 Active instead of the S7 Active I ordered without letting me know first, which meant I had to buy all new charging wires and a new protective case. The biggest issue was after 2 weeks of normal use it just stopped working altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Over heats button sticks.
customer_reviews.text: It has a giant scratch on the back It over heats all the time and smells like it might catch fire . Especially while charging using the charger sent And the back button sticks.
customer_reviews.author: paige bee

customer_reviews.title: Defective from the box
customer_reviews.text: Probably just as good as the edge we own but Sim card slot was defective right out of the box. Amazon renew certified sending it back for a full refund
customer_reviews.author: V&V family

customer_reviews.title: Sweet, badass mother- ... .. .
customer_reviews.text: Yep-yep!!! Bought this cell phone as a referb. with sum doubt, until I saw it in my house, in my hand and fell in like!! Took this bad daddy to the local AT&T, and only had to pay 5 dollar for for a new, smaller more modern card. Not but a week later fell in love... THANKS Amazon Prime -MarcusM
customer_reviews.author: MarQuis_70

customer_reviews.title: A great, tough smartphone with some glitxjhes
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace s5 refurb with broke screen and not enough space. Pretty good except no infrared to run old cable box, and doesn't recognize sync cards, so total storage is the same except easier to handle. Lost a lot of settings but may get them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Zanger

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: I didnt t like that the fingerprint code didn't work and it look as if been dropped to many times They sent a replacement in no time and it worked out find. Execpt that someone tried to order something from my Google account Smh
customer_reviews.author: Kole

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was hoping it would be
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit wary as the phone is a refurb but I'm also disgusted by $1,000 phones. I took a chance and so far so good. It is faster than my S6 was, all of the services work correctly, the SIM card went right into place and it has worked well from the start. I do believe I made a good choice and the provider did a great job!
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Great Outdoors Men
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone for my dad who manages to break every phone he gets. This phone is different he can drop it, he can work out with it and he can take it with him fishing. There have been no complaints from this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: A very good cell phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a refurb and It seems brand new. I had a S4 prior to this which served me well for a number of years and this phone is much better. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Battery is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Wow, so i bought this phone and initially thought it was a great phone. Nothing about it seemed put of place really. Until i noticed how fast the battery dies. I woke up at 7AM with casual facebook use and being on it i am at 11% at 12:51.... im having to charge my phone on TWO different occasions just to make it through the day....
customer_reviews.author: Stanley desart

customer_reviews.title: other than that it's a great phone, was easily unlocked and now used on ...
customer_reviews.text: Would give it five stars but the phone was not unlocked from AT&T as advertised, other than that it's a great phone, was easily unlocked and now used on Metro PCS.
customer_reviews.author: Dwmd16

customer_reviews.title: Had to send it back
customer_reviews.text: The hardware for my device seemed to be ok but unfortunately the software was completely screwed. It kept trying to update and rebooting but never successfully applied the updates. This happening constantly so the device was unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Bart W

customer_reviews.title: Just a really great older phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone primarily as an upgrade camerawise, and and am very happy with the picture quality, and the with whole phone in general. Terrific samsung product, the built in case is great, seems to work as a good speed for internet though i dont use it much for streaming. Not loaded w the latest processing speed like a brand new phone but its a great value for regular use. Would def buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ford Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: This is a rugged phone that will do anything you need a smartphone to do. And have battery power at the end of the day. A great phone at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good phone that doesn't break the bank.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good phone assuming you're not caught up on the latest and greatest. Love how rugged it is and that I don't really need a case for it. I have noticed going from the Motorola G5 Supra to this that my signal has gotten significantly better on phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos P.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my son. He really likes this phone. So far it works good. The only thing he doesn’t like is there’s a blue background tint that he’s working on figuring out how to change it.
customer_reviews.author: Laurawd

customer_reviews.title: My issue is that the unlocked AT&T software does not ...
customer_reviews.text: My issue is that the unlocked AT&T software does not work well with the T-mobile network. The software has a hard time establishing and maintaining connection to the T-mobile APN.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Blasen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the headache
customer_reviews.text: My phone arrived and the moment I opened the box and turned it on, there was a giant purple line running down the entire right side of the screen. Apparently I'm not the only one that had this problem. Thanks for checking things before you send them out.
customer_reviews.author: Torrie

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it... upgrade from S6 Active and it's quite different! Couple of small dings round the rubber edges but nothing to be concerned about.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from HybridIt
customer_reviews.text: HybridIt sent me a broken phone, that kept glitching on power. Finally got it to power on, entered my email and password to get set up, and it glitched again and wouldn't turn on. SUPER sketchy, I had to change my password through Google, as I couldn't reset the phone or anything to clear my info out before sending back to seller.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described and better, Just like new, Fast delivery, very satisfied. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: This s7 active is the best phone I've ever had,very durable and it's water resistant so I can take it with me fishing and on the beach,it's well designed for shock resistance too,I can be rough on phones,the price was reasonable too,it was the most expensive phone I've ever bought but it's also the best I've ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Tapley

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS REFURBISHED PHONE!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this refurbished phone hoping it would last at least a year or more but it only lasted 8 months. Now it won't turn on at all even after being plugged in to charge. Would think it would last longer for the price you pay. If I could give it less than 1 star I would. Would not recommend buying refurbished phones from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy P.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my brother, he smashed his Galaxy S7, so I gifted him these phone. Will see how it works.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not unlocked!!
customer_reviews.text: When I received phone could tell it was refurbished definitely scratched up. Also was supposed to be unlocked and tried for 2 weeks to get activated with our carrier but come to find out phone was locked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective phone!
customer_reviews.text: Product was defective since I turned it on ! Returned it and got my money back !
customer_reviews.author: Theodoros

customer_reviews.title: Love my phine
customer_reviews.text: Love the phone. I was scared to buy a refurbished phone but no regrets. Water resist I don't know but I bought a case and not that it is needed. I had one of the first active they came out with and lived it. It never broke it just got full.
customer_reviews.author: Charmin trammell

customer_reviews.title: Battery life and water proof
customer_reviews.text: I like it has a few new things on it then the active 6. Was worth the money. Battery life is really good. Great overall.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Good but not best
customer_reviews.text: Its a great phone to have for 200 $ its durable(ive dropped it on concrete and no cracks) ive gotten it wet and dryed it off with a towel no issues battery life isnt the best but good for at least 8 hrs of continuous use i would recommend carry a batterypack but still a great deal other wise 7/10
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: little to no help
customer_reviews.text: as the phone being waterproof it is garbage my phone has water in the screen I have not been able to get help from Amazon nor the company I bought it from it really really bothers me that Amazon will allow this type of business to continue
customer_reviews.author: michael Henninger

customer_reviews.title: Good for Price, Had serious Screen Burn
customer_reviews.text: My phone has a large scratch on the back of the phone, which I don't really care about. But the screen, especially on blue and green colors, has major screen burn issues. Any time you are on a white page, you can see what the previous owner's home screen looked like, and a faint outline of the keyboard. It's almost like the previous owner left their phone on home screen for hours at a time. I'd send it back but I don't want to go without a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: Flop
customer_reviews.text: Not so impressed- going back. Slow, difficult to use, and locks up regularly. Nice big screen
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: AT&T Phone Only
customer_reviews.text: It was only after extensive research of why this phone would not activate on my network that I learned that this product was produced exclusively for AT&T, and is incompatible with any other network. NOWHERE in the description did it say this. The only thing that kept this from getting one star is that the store was quick and willing to issue a return shipping label and refund.
customer_reviews.author: Elixir Luc

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price i could not ask for anything better. Works great, battery dies a bit fast but i do use FB a lot. Charges best with wireless chargers though as the plug in part can go bad quickly. But runs great no problems had for almost a year
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Ya get what you pay for, with a little extra
customer_reviews.text: Its good in a way, but if you are looking to get the most out of this model phone, I would stick with buying new. Water resistance is iffy at best, battery life is terrible, and screens can have some burn. Other than that, this phone is built well and I enjoy using it
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thomas Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Not unlocked and screen just flashes on and off
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone had it a month and npw im returning it....screen went black it will come on but glrs right back off...im returning this...i just want my money back
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: amazon renewed - disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This was an Amazon renewed product. Advertised as like new. No marks when held 12 inches away. The back of the phone is gouged, dinged and dirtt looking. phone is hard used. very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jane W

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice phone. It's been several weeks since I got it, and there are zero issues. This S7 beats the stuffing out of HTC M8 it replaced; and as for the refurbisher, I would buy from them again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Phone exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the phone for a few days, but so far it seems as good as a new one. I think the seller's description was spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like improvments.
customer_reviews.text: I like the access port for the charger - much improved over active 5 model. Still getting use it (the phone) but so far I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Johng

customer_reviews.title: Price
customer_reviews.text: My Dad loves his new phone I got him we’ll see how long it last. Bought case and protectors along with it so i do hope he’ll enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: knox security locks me out
customer_reviews.text: this phone comes with a knox security that prevents me from using the phone after i set up my account. i have ordered many phones off amazon and this is the first one that is giving me this issue. in fact i ordered 2 other s7 edge for a friend and myself before and we have no issues but this one i cant use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good phone, not unlocked, bad battery
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, came in like brand new, only noticable difference from new was the battery life was cut in almost half, but still lasts me a whole day. Only thing I'm really dissatisfied wi thg us the fact it is NOT unlocked. You can only have att service if you order this specific item.
customer_reviews.author: Peter haddock

customer_reviews.title: Even a smartphone can have a glitch.
customer_reviews.text: The sound button don't seem to work. This is my first smartphone so I am still learning how to use it. For now I can adjust the volume from my settings.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product but the screen has now failed me on to another phone. Stay away from used OLED phones
customer_reviews.author: Kevon Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Charger port is vulnerable but other than that it's a great rugged little unit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Elliott

product_meta.title: Samsung Galaxy S7 ACTIVE G891A 32GB Unlocked GSM Shatter-Resistant, Extremely Durable Smartphone w/ 12MP Camera - Titanium Gray (Renewed)
product_meta.description: Color:GrayFinally, your Galaxy wont fall to pieces - Engineered to be shatter-resistant, the Galaxy S7 active gives you extra protection, making the occasional fumble, stumble or drop nothing to worry about. All without sacrificing the screen quality of the Quad HD Super AMOLED display, so you can lose yourself in movies, games and more. Revolutionary dual-pixel technology gives you professional camera performance. With an autofocus that works faster than the blink of an eye, you can say goodbye to blurry photos. And bigger pixels and a wider aperture capture more light for better low-light photos. The Galaxy S7 active takes stunning photos every time. Running out of memory should never be a thing. With the Samsung Galaxy S7 active, it won't be. If 32GB isn't already enough, you can expand your memory up to an additional 200GB with a microSD card. Forget the cloud or having to search for a hard drive. All your photos and 4K videos are always in one place and in your hands. Samsung Pay is the mobile payment service that works almost anywhere you can swipe or tap your card. From local grocery stores to corner coffee shops to taco trucks, it's highly secure and simple to use with the latest Samsung Galaxy devices.
feature_bullets: 5.1-inch Super AMOLED Capacitive Touchscreen, 1440 x 2560 pixel resolution (~576ppi pixel density) + Corning Gorilla Glass 4 w/ TouchWiz UI

12 Megapixel Camera with f/1.7, 26mm, phase detection autofocus, OIS, LED flash, 1/2.5" sensor size, 1.4 µm pixel size, geo-tagging, simultaneous 4K video and 9MP image recording, touch focus, face/smile detection, Auto HDR, panorama + 5 Megapixel Front Camera with f/1.7, 22mm, dual video call, Auto HDR
Internal Memory: 32GB, 4GB RAM - microSD Up to 256GB
WLAN: Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, dual-band, Wi-Fi Direct, hotspot; Bluetooth: v4.2, A2DP, LE, aptX; GPS: Yes, with A-GPS, GLONASS; NFC: Yes; Radio: Stereo FM Radio, RDS; USB: microUSB v2.0, USB Host

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars417 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
